text: Sorry for asking a Pythonish question on this forum but can anyone point me to where I might see an example of reading a file in the Arrow file format using `pyarrow.feather.read_feather?`

elements.text: Sorry for asking a Pythonish question on this forum but can anyone point me to where I might see an example of reading a file in the Arrow file format using

text: I have gone through that but it only gives an example of writing from python then reading back into python.  I haven't been able to figure out why an Arrow-format file written from R can't be read by the Python `read_feather`.  It would make sense if the python `read_feather` was expecting version 1 of the Feather format but, according to the docs it should read version 2 or version 1.

elements.text: I have gone through that but it only gives an example of writing from python then reading back into python.  I haven't been able to figure out why an Arrow-format file written from R can't be read by the Python
.  It would make sense if the python
was expecting version 1 of the Feather format but, according to the docs it should read version 2 or version 1.

Attaching package: ‘arrow’

The following object is masked from ‘package:utils’:

    timestamp

> write_feather(datasets::iris, "/tmp/iris.feather")
>
Save workspace image? [y/n/c]: n
bates@EliteDesk:~$ python
Python 3.8.5 (default, Sep  4 2020, 07:30:14)
[GCC 7.3.0] :: Anaconda, Inc. on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import pyarrow.feather as feather
>>> feather.read_feather('/tmp/iris.feather')
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/bates/.julia/conda/3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pyarrow/feather.py", line 214, in read_feather
    reader = FeatherReader(source)
  File "/home/bates/.julia/conda/3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pyarrow/feather.py", line 40, in __init__
    self.open(source)
  File "pyarrow/feather.pxi", line 83, in pyarrow.lib.FeatherReader.open
  File "pyarrow/error.pxi", line 78, in pyarrow.lib.check_status
pyarrow.lib.ArrowInvalid: Not a feather file
>>>

text: hmmm, I think the python `feather` functions may be for the older feather version. I think you can just use the regular read arrow functions instead.

elements.text: functions may be for the older feather version. I think you can just use the regular read arrow functions instead.

text: I think I may have solved the problem.  I didn't install pyarrow from conda-forge so it seems I had a very old version.  I'll try again.

elements.text: I think I may have solved the problem.  I didn't install pyarrow from conda-forge so it seems I had a very old version.  I'll try again.

text: My problem was that I had an old version of pyarrow.  Conda is very confusing.
